user.title: Thermostat Proxy
user.description: Set up a virtual thermostat that sits in front of your physical one, letting you use any temperature sensor in your home.

data_description.thermostat: The real thermostat this proxy will control.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Thermostat Proxy
reconfigure.description: Change the name or swap the physical thermostat behind this proxy, then update your sensors.

data_description.thermostat: The real thermostat this proxy will control.

sensors.title: Temperature sensors
sensors.description: Give this sensor a friendly name — it will appear as a preset mode on the thermostat card. You can add more sensors afterwards.

data.name: Sensor name
data.add_another: Add another sensor after this one

data_description.entity_id: Any entity that reports a temperature (e.g. a room sensor, outdoor sensor, or another climate entity).

manage_sensors.title: Manage sensors
manage_sensors.description: Current sensors: {sensor_list}. Add or remove sensors, or continue to finish setup.

remove_sensor.title: Remove a sensor
remove_sensor.description: Select a sensor to remove from this thermostat.

finalize.title: Behaviour & safety
finalize.description: Fine-tune how the proxy behaves. Defaults work well for most setups — only change these if you need to.

data.ssot_settings: Protect these settings from thermostat changes

data_description.physical_sensor_name: The name shown when you switch to the thermostat's own built-in sensor. Change this if "Physical Entity" isn't clear enough.
data_description.cooldown_period: Prevents the proxy from sending adjustments too rapidly. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.min_temp: The proxy will never set the real thermostat below this temperature. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.max_temp: The proxy will never set the real thermostat above this temperature. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.ssot_settings: When someone adjusts these settings directly on the physical thermostat (or via its own app), the proxy will undo the change and keep its own value. Useful if the thermostat resets settings on its own.
data_description.it_settings: The proxy will always override the physical thermostat for these settings — any change from the device is immediately reverted. This is stricter than protection above and is useful for settings you never want the physical device to control. Protected-from-changes is turned on automatically for any setting you select here.
data_description.default_sensor: Which temperature sensor to use when Home Assistant restarts.

error.duplicate_sensor_entity: Each entity can only be used once.
error.reserved_sensor_name: That name is reserved for the physical thermostat sensor.
error.no_sensors: Add at least one sensor before finishing.
error.invalid_default_sensor: Select a sensor from the list.
error.physical_name_conflict: Choose a different name for the physical thermostat preset.
error.already_configured: This unique ID is already in use.
error.invalid_temp_range: Minimum temperature must be less than maximum temperature.
